type.description:
The masonry view is the default view type. It sorts cards in columns based on their size.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/masonry/

badges.description:
List of entities IDs or badge objects to display as badges. Note that badges do not show when view is in panel mode.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/dashboards-and-views/#badges

cards.description:
Cards to display in this view.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/dashboards-and-views/#cards

path.description:
You can link to one view from a card in another view when using cards that support navigation (navigation_path). The string supplied here will be appended to the string /lovelace/ to create the path to the view.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/dashboards-and-views/#path

theme.description:
Set a separate theme for the view and its cards.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/dashboards-and-views/#theme

visible.description:
You can specify the visibility of views as a whole or per-user. (Note: This is only for the display of the tabs. The URL path is still accessible.)
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/dashboards-and-views/#visible

type.description:
Badges are widgets that sit at the top of a Lovelace panel, above all the cards.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/badges/

The Alarm Panel card allows you to Arm and Disarm your alarm control panel integrations.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/alarm-panel/

states.description:
Controls which states to have available.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/alarm-panel/#states

theme.description:
Set to any theme within themes.yaml.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/alarm-panel/#theme

view_layout.description: Layout options for the view this card is in

position.description:
Defines the position of the card in an sidebar view.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/sidebar/#view_layoutposition

type.description:
The Area card lets you control and monitor an individual area.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/area/

area.description:
The ID of the area to show.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/area/#area

show_camera.description:
Changes the area picture to a live feed of the camera set for the area.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/area/#show_camera

theme.description:
Override the used theme for this card with any loaded theme.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/area/#theme

type.description:
The Alarm Panel card allows you to Arm and Disarm your alarm control panel integrations.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/button/

double_tap_action.description:
The action taken on card double-tap.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/button/#double_tap_action

entity.description:
The entity ID the card interacts with, for example, light.living_room.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/button/#entity

hold_action.description:
The action taken on card tap and hold.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/button/#hold_action

icon_height.description:
The height of the icon. Any CSS value may be used.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/button/#icon_height

icon.description:
The icon that is displayed on the card. It defaults to the entity domain icon only if the card interacts with an entity. Otherwise, if not configured, no icon is displayed.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/button/#icon

name.description:
The button name that is displayed on the card. It defaults to the entity name only if the card interacts with an entity. Otherwise, if not configured, no name is displayed.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/button/#name

show_icon.description:
If false, the icon is not shown on the card.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/button/#show_icon

show_name.description:
If false, the button name is not shown on the card.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/button/#show_name

show_state.description:
If false, the button state is not shown on the card.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/button/#show_state

state_color.description:
If false, the icon does not change color when the entity is active.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/button/#state_color

tap_action.description:
The action taken on card tap.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/button/#tap_action

theme.description:
The card theme, which may be set to any theme from the themes.yaml file.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/button/#theme

view_layout.description: Layout options for the view this card is in

text.description:
Text to present in the confirmation dialog.

user.description:

confirmation.description:

type.description:
The Map card that allows you to display entities on a map.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/map/

entities.description:
List of entity IDs. Either this or the geo_location_sources configuration option is required.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/map/#entities

geo_location_sources.description:
List of geolocation sources. All current entities with that source will be displayed on the map. See Geolocation platform for valid sources. Set to all to use all available sources. Either this or the entities configuration option is required.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/map/#geo_location_sources

aspect_ratio.description:
Forces the height of the image to be a ratio of the width. You may enter a value such as: 16x9, 16:9, 1.78.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/map/#aspect_ratio

default_zoom.description:
The default zoom level of the map.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/map/#default_zoom

dark_mode.description:
Enable a dark theme for the map.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/map/#dark_mode

hours_to_show.description:
Shows a path of previous locations. Hours to show as path on the map.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/map/#hours_to_show

type.description:
The Media Control card is used to display Media Player entities on an interface with easy to use controls.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/media-control/

content.description:
Content to render as Markdown. May contain templates.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/markdown/#content

card_size.description:
The algorithm for placing cards aesthetically in Lovelace may have problems with the Markdown card if it contains templates. You can use this value to help it estimate the height of the card in units of 50 pixels (approximately 3 lines of text in default size). (e.g., 4).
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/markdown/#card_size

entity_id.description:
A list of entity IDs so a template in content: only reacts to the state changes of these entities. This can be used if the automatic analysis fails to find all relevant entities.
https://www.home-assistant.io/lovelace/markdown/#entity_id

theme.description: Set to any theme within themes.yaml.
